packagecontents.text: (1) E3000 router with embedded LTE Advanced Pro (C18B) modem

insertSim:
Insert activated SIM cards

  1. Remove the modem door (check for presence of modem door screw).


  1. Insert an active 2FF-sized SIM card into the slot with the contacts up and notch in. It will click into place. Depress the SIM card to remove it.
  1. Repeat for SIM 2 if needed.



Insert external MC400 modem (optional)

  1. Insert 1 or 2 active 2FF-sized SIM cards in to the MC400 modem.


  1. Insert the MC400 modem into the router. USB port in. Cradlepoint logo up.



  1. Replace the MC400 modem door and secure with modem door screw.



    • NOTE: Peel off the modem door decal to expose antenna port openings (MC400-600M only).

    • NOTE: The modem door must be on the device or the embedded modem will not power on.
attachCellularAntenna:
Attach the 4G LTE antennas

  1. Attach the four cellular modem antennas (included) to the connectors.
    • NOTE: Cellular antennas include RP-SMA connectors (pin in the center on the antenna) while Wi-Fi antennas include SMA connectors (pin in the center on the device connection point). Ensure you connect the correct antennas to their applicable connection locations.


  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base of the antenna to connect to the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on diagram using the included antenna alignment tool.



Attach MC400 4G LTE antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the connectors.



  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base to thread onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on the diagrams below.
attachWifiAntenna:
Attach the Wi-Fi antennas

  1. Attach the included Wi-Fi antennas to the connectors.


  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base to thread onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Align the antenna at a 90-degree angle to the mounting surface.
getConnect:
Connecting a Wired WAN

  1. Connect the provided Ethernet cable to the WAN port of the router (Port WAN is default WAN. All ports are LAN/WAN switchable). Connect the other end to your WAN source.
    • NOTE: The port labeled
is the default. However, all ports are LAN/WAN switchable.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
  1. Switch the device to ON (O = OFF, â€“ = ON). The LED lights will begin lighting up.
